article: I'm feeling sad.My 19-year-old[?]nleft home about a week ago to _ the Air Force, and my 23-year-old daughter left two days ago to marry in another state.I'm so _ of my son as he had to really work hard to get into the Air Force, and my daughter moved to be with her fiance .I'm just simply upset.It _ feels like someone has ripped my heart from my chest.I've tried to talk to their father, friends, and family but it just feels like no one around me _ what I'm going through. My children were _ to me.I put all my energy into _ both of them and doing all types of activities with them, even sometimes at the _ of my own best interests.I understand they grow up and need their _ ,but for some reason I just can't seem to let go.I am go _ that they're establishing their own lives, _ I get so depressed whenever I have even a simple _ of them.I've been crying for over a week now.I really don't know what to do to make this _ go away.I can't even walk by either one's room without bursting into tears.I don't understand why I'm unable to _ this sense of great loss.I'm _ that I need to move on with my own life and find _ things to devote my attention to, but I _ being a mom and spending time on my children.I've _ adopting a child but it's _ atthe moment for me considering my poor health. I'm just thankful to have found this website and found there are others who are _ similar problems.It helps to _ I'm not crazy or overreacting.Thank you for sharing your problems and showing others like myself this isn't so abnormal.
